title: Mogre Camp

properties.value: The Mogre Camp is an underwater area accessed during and after saving Pirate Pete for Recipe for Disaster. In order to enter the underwater area, the player must equip a fishbowl helmet and a diving apparatus and weigh less than 27 kilograms, and speak to Murphy at Port Khazard to go diving. The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Mogre Camp
This article is about the underwater area beneath Port Khazard. For other uses, see Underwater (disambiguation).
Mogre Camp
Released15 March 2006 (Update)
MembersYes
LocationPort Khazard
MusicDavy Jones' Locker
Map
Advanced data
Typedungeon

The Mogre Camp is an underwater area accessed during and after saving Pirate Pete for Recipe for Disaster. In order to enter the underwater area, the player must equip a fishbowl helmet and a diving apparatus and weigh less than 27 kilograms, and speak to Murphy at Port Khazard to go diving. The brine sabre's special attacks can also be used down here.

Kelp, which can be ground and used as an ingredient for fishcakes (used for freeing Pirate Pete during Recipe for Disaster), also grows here.

Contents

  • 1 Monsters
  • 2 Personalities
  • 3 Fish species
  • 4 Trivia

Monsters[edit | edit source]

  • Mudskippers
  • Crabs

Personalities[edit | edit source]

  • Nung
  • Mogre Guards

Fish species[edit | edit source]

A large coral reef grows in the centre of the Mogre Camp.

The nature of the Southern Sea in which the Mogre Camp exists has allowed for a large array of fish to inhabit the area. They cannot be caught, but can be seen swimming amongst the coral. The following species have been identified:

  • Harlequin Fish
  • Red Fantail
  • Paradise Fish
  • Pearl Danio
  • Discus Fish
  • Black Moor Fantail
  • Angel Fish
  • Neon Tetra

Trivia[edit | edit source]

The Mogre Camp's appearance without the water overlay.
  • The camp can partially be seen from the Asgarnian Ice Dungeon. Players can use an oculus orb to see further into the area without the water overlay.
  • It is possible for players to get random events while underwater. Events such as the Drunken Dwarf would have a diving apparatus on, and the swarm event's description would change from "A swarm of vicious insects!" to "A swarm of vicious plankton!".

The '''Mogre Camp''' is an underwater area accessed during and after saving [[Pirate Pete]] for [[Recipe for Disaster]]. In order to enter the underwater area, the player must equip a [[fishbowl helmet]] and a [[diving apparatus]] and weigh less than 27 kilograms, and speak to [[Murphy]] at [[Port Khazard]] to go diving. The [[brine sabre]]'s special attacks can also be used down here.

[[Kelp]], which can be [[Ground kelp|ground]] and used as an ingredient for [[Raw fishcake|fishcakes]] (used for freeing Pirate Pete during Recipe for Disaster), also grows here.

==Monsters==
*[[Mudskipper]]s
*[[Crab]]s

==Personalities==
*[[Nung]]
*[[Mogre Guard]]s

==Fish species==
[[File:Reef.png|thumb|right|A large {{Wp|coral reef}} grows in the centre of the Mogre Camp.]]
The nature of the [[Southern Sea]] in which the Mogre Camp exists has allowed for a large array of fish to inhabit the area. They cannot be caught, but can be seen swimming amongst the coral. The following species have been identified:

*[[Fish (harlequin)|Harlequin Fish]]
*[[Fish (red fantail)|Red Fantail]]
*[[Fish (paradise)|Paradise Fish]]
*[[Fish (pearl danio)|Pearl Danio]]
*[[Fish (discus)|Discus Fish]]
*[[Fish (black moor fantail)|Black Moor Fantail]]
*[[Fish (angelfish)|Angel Fish]]
*[[Fish (neon tetra)|Neon Tetra]]

==Trivia==
[[File:Mogre Camp without water.png|thumb|right|The Mogre Camp's appearance without the water overlay.]]
*The camp can partially be seen from the [[Asgarnian Ice Dungeon]]. Players can use an [[oculus orb]] to see further into the area without the water overlay.
*It is possible for players to get [[random events]] while underwater. Events such as the [[Drunken Dwarf]] would have a [[diving apparatus]] on, and the [[Swarm (random event)|swarm]] event's description would change from "A swarm of vicious insects!" to "A swarm of vicious plankton!".
